meanings.definition: To expose to public scorn or ridicule.
meanings.sent1: The naughty student was pilloried by his classmates for cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was pilloried by the media for her controversial remarks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was pilloried by the other dogs for stealing their toys.
meanings.sent4: The politician felt like he was pilloried by the entire nation after his scandal was exposed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules pilloried any student who dared to break them.

meanings.sent1: The film critic pilloried the new movie for its poor acting and plot.
meanings.sent2: The boss pilloried the employee for constantly arriving late to work.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pilloried his own terrible jokes during the stand-up show.
meanings.sent4: The coach pilloried the team for their lackluster performance in the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher pilloried any student who failed to complete their homework on time.
